metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20231 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in gnutls. A use after free issue in client sending key_share extension may lead to memory corruption and other consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20231` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.7.1-4ubuntu1
guile-gnutls - 3.7.1-4ubuntu1
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.7.1-4ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.7.1-4ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.7.1-4ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.7.1-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.1-4ubuntu1').
